value.title: The Responsible Innovation Framework For The Age Of AI

value.title: Many Top AI Researchers Get Financial Backing From Big Tech
value.excerpt: Abdalla found that more than half of tenure-track AI faculty at four prominent universities who disclose their funding sources have received some sort of backing from Big Tech. Abdalla says he doesn’t believe any of those faculty are acting unethically ...

value.title: AI and ethics: One-third of executives are not aware of potential AI bias
value.excerpt: The majority of consumers expect companies to be accountable for their AI systems, yet about half of companies do not have a dedicated member overseeing ethical AI implementation.

value.title: MIT Report How AI changes the world

value.title: Fast-Tracking AI Ethics Is Dicey And Shortsighted, Especially For Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: There seems to be quite a rush to get AI systems out-the-door these days. Unfortunately, there is a devilish price to be paid in such a rush to judgment and the associated misguided assumption that the soonest AI is the best kind of AI.

value.title: AI Has Resulted In “Ethical Issues” For 90% Of Businesses
value.excerpt: A new report from Capgemini has revealed that 90% of organizations are aware of at least one instance where an AI system had resulted in ethical issues for their business. The report, titled “AI and the Ethical Conundrum: How organizations can build ethically robust AI systems and gain trust” has found that while digital and AI-enabled interactions with customers are on the rise as customers seek contactless or non-touch interfaces amid the COVID-19 pandemic,

value.title: The National Guard’s Fire-Mapping Drones Get an AI Upgrade
value.excerpt: Algorithms that quickly track the movement of wildfires could help firefighters‚ but the tech could also be put to non-humanitarian use.

value.title: Amsterdam and Helsinki launch algorithm registries to bring transparency to public deployments of AI
value.excerpt: Amsterdam and Helsinki today launched AI registries to detail how each city uses algorithms to deliver services.

value.title: UK and US marked down on responsible AI
value.excerpt: The UK and US have been rated as leaders in government use of artificial intelligence, but the Nordics and Baltics attained the highest scores for responsible AI.

value.title: Our goal shouldn’t be to build merely ‘trustworthy’ AI
value.excerpt: Mariarosaria Taddeo, Deputy Director of the Oxford Internet Institute's Digital Ethics Lab, explains why AI ethics must be a continuous practice.

value.title: To Make Fairer AI, Physicists Peer Inside Its Black Box
value.excerpt: After repurposing facial recognition and deepfake tech to study galaxies and the Higgs boson, physicists think they can help shape the responsible use of AI.

value.title: When AI in healthcare goes wrong, who is responsible?
value.excerpt: In all these cases, studies suggest AI outperforms human doctors in set tasks. But when something does go wrong, who is responsible? There’s no easy answer, says Patrick Lin, director of Ethics and Emerging Sciences Group at California Polytechnic State University.

value.title: Reps. Hurd, Kelly Formalize National AI Strategy Resolution

value.title: Unethical AI unfairly impacts protected classes - and everybody else as well
value.excerpt: We've established that unethical AI hurts protected classes - but it doesn't stop there. Across industries and regions, unethical AI can impact the entire population. Here's some questions to consider.

value.title: Life academy promotes ethical ways AI can with help food security
value.excerpt: As part of its ongoing collaboration with two of the world's leading developers of AI software, the Pontifical Academy for Life will launch a new joint project looking at ethical ways artificial intelligence can be used to guarantee food security.

value.title: AI ethics groups are repeating one of society’s classic mistakes

value.title: AI ethics - why teaching ethics and "ethics training" is problematic
value.excerpt: We've been trying to teach "ethics" for years. Teaching AI ethics to organizations is proving to be just as problematic. Yet as the urgency of ethical AI increases, we need a way forward. What are the options?

value.title: AI regulators can learn a lesson from the 1967 Outer Space Treaty
value.excerpt: Global leaders should take a lesson from the 1967 Outer Space Treaty, which regulated another emerging tech at a time of geopolitical turmoil.

value.title: How the Trevor Project is using AI to prevent LGBTQ suicides
value.excerpt: Over the past three years, the nation’s largest suicide prevention organization for LGBTQ youth has undergone a major tech overhaul, most recently using machine learning to assess high-risk outreach.

value.title: Why eliminating bias in AI is key to its success

value.title: Scalise hit with ethics complaint over doctored Barkan video
value.excerpt: The House Democratic campaign arm has filed a formal ethics complaint against Republican Whip Rep. Steve Scalise (La.), who shared a video doctored to alter the wording of a question posed by activist Ady Barkan to former Vice President Joe Biden.

value.title: Can Google’s New AI Ethics Service Be Of Any Help?
value.excerpt: Google’s cloud division has come out with their new AI Ethics Services for helping companies developing AI solutions.
